intro: Calamintha granatensis var. erecta, commonly known as the upright candytuft, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, woolly stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its fragrance and compact growth habit make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
